question:
Which among the following pairs of winds is/are correctly matched?
  1. Trade winds - the belt extending from 30° to 60° latitude from the ITCZ.
  2. Westerlies - the belt extending as far as 30° north and south latitude of ITCZ
  3. Easterlies - belt covers from 60° latitudes to the north and south poles
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation:
Trade winds are planetary or permanent winds which are extremely steady blowing from sub-tropical high pressure areas (30 degree N and S) towards the equatorial low pressure belt.
The westerlies are permanent winds which originate from sub tropical high pressure belt and move towards subpolar low pressure belt. They prevail between 35° to 60 ° latitudes.
Easterlies cover  from 60° latitudes to the north and south poles.
